column5: It can't be spring yet! My soft water still has 3 feet of hard stuff on top of it.
Still -12C up here, but that South wind is working on it.  Keith...        Just watch that Phil guy doesn't steal all the big ones on you...
Ok laugh, it up wise guys.  I was told I have sexy legs,right J.
How drunk was HE ? !
QUOTE(misfish @ Mar 21 2007, 10:38 AM) I was told I have sexy legs,right J.   How drunk was HE ? !     I knew it was turkey season. You turkey.LOL
LOL   LOL   LOL... now they are looking at me wondering why I am laughing out loud at work
Just tell them your thinking of your bud in a dress - they will understand...  Or avoid you for a while
I don't know about you, but I'm ready for the warm weather.....bring it on
Good Morning Lew and Good Bye Winter.  Although it's still chilly this morn the end is near.

I did my happy dance at o8.07 PM .  Bring on the heat and those lazy crazy days of summer . I cant wait for the big week of lakiar to get hear ANYONE got pictures of the camp or water ways would be nice to see. I have never been up that way before . LOVE to see what I am getting  into .   THANKS . KEITH
Yowza!!
Speak for yer own area Lew.It,s still -10 here this morning.Forget spring,lets just jump into summer.LOL  I must be getting old or lew syndrom.LOL

Yup, a little chilly in the mornings still...but the signs are there, soon instead of all the snow in my back yard I'll be seeing brown grass, then next thing ya know I'll be mowing the lawn everyweek, losing a day of fishing for my trouble ....but  with the soft water I'll get to try out my new outfit...I hope...Happy srping all  Maureen
oh yeah I'm ready for the warm weather

We are a little bit ahead of ya down here. No more snow or ice. Everything looks brown and nasty until it starts pushing green which won't be long! We have tulips that have statred coming up in the flower beds and some of the trees are starting to bud. Birds are chirping, all is well.  Whopper

We're getting there. Another month and a half and we'll be fishing, cutting grass, getting eaten by bugs, getting sunburned and generally enjoying ourselves in warmer weather. Bring on the warm weather!!!

Spring has finally sprung!!  Actually looking foward to the rainy days of spring.  Environment Canada is saying we are going to have a warmer and drier April/May/June, but we know how good they are at forecasting tomorrow's temps let alone a whole season!  Hopefully the steelies will be running this weekend after today and tomorrow's rain!
GOBBLE GOBBLE GOBBLE!!!!!!!!!! BRING IT ON!!!!!!!!!!
I've been ready for the spring since Jan 1!    Bring it on...  Mike
Pick up my new boat in 2 weeks. Now that will be a sign of spring
Morning Lew, warm weather bring it on.     You're in for a treat Keith, here you go.
Thanks for posting the pics!  Bly and I will be camping there for the G2G in June....cant wait!
Bring on the sun dresses, skirts, tank tops and heels   I'm ready  Joey

You'll enjoy it. One suggestion for you since you are heading up in June...bring lots of bug spray and citronella candles.   We're actually going up towards the end of August for 2 weeks, bugs are gone.  It is one of my most favorite places.  Kevin and Leslie are top notch people.  Do yourself a favour, have a meal or two or three....in their dining room, Leslie is an amazing cook.
Lew the warm weather is right around the corner.  Bring on da spring.
The anticipation is a killer Bring it on!
50`s and 60 here for the next 7 days, it`s got to be headed your way!
Blue water, western breezes, walleye on the other end of a fishing pole. Yeee Haaaa!
-7 in the hammer this morning, excellent first day of spring
Me too.
there's an image I want out of my head..........     oh..oh..you mean you want to see them and not that you want to wear them......lol  I hope....lol
ROTFLMAO !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!...Good one Terry...
